intro: Mariosousa acatlensis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
